Specifically, the legislation would prevent federal court challenges to the Defense of Marriage Act, a federal law passed in 1996 that defines marriage as a relationship between a man and a woman and holds that states are not bound to recognize same-sex marriages that might be legally recognized in other states. For example, once in the middle of a conversation with some co-workers a guy mentioned that his supervisor,"was being a Fag". I, knowing both the person who said it (lets call him Cee) and knowing his supervisor, (Andy, sorry I won't change the name of the Guilty,) knew exactly what he was talking about. Andy was,and is today I am sure, Anal retentive, Meticulous on details, but also unaware of the outside effects of his , dry, hostile, way of being. I did not take it to mean he was homosexual, as is one often used negative explicative, but meaning he was, in better terms, useless as a ciggarette butt. Still Cee came back and apologized to me a few minutes later for talking that way in front of me, and he meant no offense.I told him honestly, the fact that without thinking you felt comfortable enough with me to use that word, makes me feel good about myself. If someone else had overheard and was offended, sorry thats what you get for evesedropping. The real point is that there IS understanding and communication. Sometimes, just sometimes, the old way is best, and most universally understood. As In Bush is an Arrogant Jackass.

What is gender? Is it a determination made on primary sexual characteristics (as in having a penis or vagina), or is it genetically determined by chromosomes. A better question still, is the defense of marriage act going to require all people to be genetically tested in order to validate their marriage? In many Olympic qualifications in addition to being tested for performance enhancing drugs, a test of gender is conducted, regardless of outward sexual characteristics, to insure that the woman (or man) in the event scheduled is qualified to compete as such, a male or female. Some did not pass and were not allowed to compete. This is not saying the person in question was transgendered, and most of those found to be the opposite sex never even had a clue that they were in fact, not who they thought they were, genetically speaking. By those same medical standards, if I (a male) or my mate (also male), were tested and one of us were found to be genetically female, should I/we be legally allowed to marry, regardless of our appearance? If during an exam, a married woman, discover she was actually a male genetically speaking, should her marriage be dissolved, and should the doctor be Legally Obligated to report the findings of the tests? Perhaps this line of reasoning should be further explored in order to put the debate to an end. I was taught as a child not to judge by outward appearance, that an ugly person may in fact be a handsome loving individual, and vice versa. In this day with equal rights for both male and female, all races, creeds, ad infinitum, why are so many people worried about what I have in my pants, what I do with it, and with whom?

I read this off the Net about what Reverend Sharpton Had to say, (Paraphrazed) This is not about a party. It is about living up to the promise of America. The promise of America says that we will guarantee quality education for all children, and not spend more for metal detectors than computers in our schools. The promise of America guarantees health care for all of its citizens, and does not force seniors to travel to Canada to buy prescription drugs they cannot afford here. The promise of America provides that those who work in our health care system can afford to be hospitalized in the very beds that they clean everyday. The promise of America is government that does not seek to regulate your behavior in the bedroom but to guarantee your right to provide food in the kitchen. The promise of America is that we stand for human rights - whether it's fighting slavery in Sudan, AIDS in Lesotho, or police brutality in this country. The promise of America is one immigration policy for all who seek to enter our shores, whether they come from Mexico, Haiti, or Canada. The promise of America is that every citizen's vote is counted and protected, and election schemes do not decide elections. I often hear the Republican party preach about family values, but I can tell them something about family values. Family values don't just exist for those with two-car garages and retirement plans. Family values exist in homes with only one parent in the household making a way against the odds. I stand here tonight, the product of a single parent home, from the depths of Brooklyn, New York. My mother was a domestic worker who scrubbed floors in other people's homes for me. And because she scrubbed those floors, I was proud to stand as a presidential candidate. Those are family values. I recall that a few days after the September 11 terrorist attacks I was in a radio station that played "America the Beautiful," as sung by Ray Charles. As you know, we lost Ray several weeks ago, but I can still hear him singing: "Oh beautiful for spacious skies, for amber waves of grain, for purple mountains majesty, above the fruited plain." We must leave here committed to making Ray Charles' song a reality and to making America beautiful for everyone. These are words from Al Sharptons Speech to the Democratic convention. While I may Not always agree with Reverend Sharpton, It does seem like he is on the right Track. Maybe there is some Hope, That the True Americans may Yet wake up and do the Right Thing. Vote the Bigot and Liar in Chief Out of Office and into a War Crimes Tribunal where He belongs, he should be a cellmate of Saddam. I think they might get Married.....

This was found on the 'net YOU WILL RECEIVE A BODY... You may like it or hate it, but it will be yours for the entire period you're around. YOU WILL LEARN LESSONS... You are enrolled in a full-time informal school called life. Each day in this school you will have the opportunity to learn lessons. You may like the lessons or think them irrelevant and stupid. THERE ARE NO MISTAKES, ONLY LESSONS... Growth is a process of trial and error, experimentation. The "Failed" experiments are as much a part of the process as the experiment that ultimately "works". A LESSON IS REPEATED UNTIL LEARNED... A lesson will be presented to you in various forms until you have learned it. When you have learned it, you can then go on to the next lesson. LEARNING LESSONS DOES NOT END... There is no part of life that does not contain its lessons. If you are alive, there are lessons to be learned. "THERE" IS NO BETTER THAN "HERE"... When your "There" has become a "Here", you will simply obtain another "There" that will, again, look better than "Here". OTHERS ARE MERELY MIRRORS OF YOU... You cannot love or hate something about another person unless it reflects to you something you love or hate about yourself. WHAT YOU MAKE OF YOUR LIFE IS UP TO YOU... You have all the tools and resources you need. What you do with them is up to you. The choice is yours. YOUR ANSWERS LIE INSIDE YOU... The answers to life's questions lie inside you. All you need to do is look, listen and trust. YOU WILL FORGET ALL THIS... Unless you consistently stay focused on the goals you have set for yourself, everything you've just read won't mean a thing.
